clinical_recommendation.cpic_guideline: CPIC Guideline for CODEINE and CYP2D6

llm_generated_explanation.summary: Your genetic profile shows you are a poor metabolizer of codeine due to your CYP2D6 *4/*4 genotype. This means codeine will not convert to morphine in your body, making it ineffective for pain relief. Your doctor should prescribe an alternative pain medication.
llm_generated_explanation.mechanism: CYP2D6 encodes a hepatic cytochrome P450 enzyme that O-demethylates codeine to morphine (the active analgesic). The *4/*4 diplotype contains rs3892097, a splice-site variant that renders CYP2D6 non-functional. With absent CYP2D6 activity, codeine cannot be bioactivated, resulting in negligible morphine plasma concentrations and inadequate analgesia. CPIC (PMID: 22205192) recommends avoiding codeine in CYP2D6 poor metabolizers.
